summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) staff discussing press guidance and logistics for the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell. It includes details about courtroom arrangements, witness anonymity, and the charges against Maxwell.

persons.name: Janis Echenberg
persons.context: SDNY staff member coordinating trial logistics and press guidance for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

persons.name: Nicholas Biase
persons.context: SDNY press office staff member seeking and providing information about trial timing and press arrangements.

persons.name: James Margolin
persons.context: SDNY contractor copied on emails regarding press guidance and exhibit access for the Maxwell trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant on trial, charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to entice and traffic minors for illegal sexual activity.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier named as the co-conspirator with Ghislaine Maxwell in the charges.

persons.name: Alison Nathan
persons.context: Presiding judge over the U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell trial at the Thurgood Marshall U.S. Courthouse.

persons.name: Damian
persons.context: Mentioned as attending the trial openings, likely a government attorney or staff member.

persons.name: Margaret
persons.context: Mentioned as attending the trial openings, likely a government attorney or staff member.

persons.name: Eric Blachman
persons.context: Mentioned as having reserved a seat in the courtroom, likely from the press office.

connections.description: Maxwell is charged with conspiring with Epstein to entice minors to travel to engage in illegal sex acts.
Colleagues within the U.S. Attorney's Office coordinating on press guidance and trial logistics.
Colleagues/contractor relationship; Margolin is copied on guidance emails and manages exhibit access.
Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal trial of defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Jury Charge and Opening Statements in U.S. v. Maxwell
events.description: Scheduled jury charge followed by opening statements in the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell before Judge Alison Nathan.

events.title: Final Pretrial Conference
events.description: Final pretrial conference held in U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell before the trial began.

locations: Courtroom 318, 40 Foley Square (Thurgood Marshall U.S. Courthouse)
Overflow Courtrooms 110, 506, 905, and 906 of the Thurgood Marshall U.S. Courthouse
keyFacts: The court granted a government motion allowing several witnesses to testify under pseudonyms to protect the identities of alleged victims.
Ghislaine Maxwell faced six charges including conspiracy to entice minors, transportation of minors, and sex trafficking of minors, with maximum prison sentences ranging from 5 to 40 years.
Government exhibits for the trial were provided exclusively through an SDNY file share (USAFx), requiring media to establish access accounts.
The email chain reveals coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office to manage press access and logistics for the high-profile trial.
The document confirms Jeffrey Epstein is named as the co-conspirator with Ghislaine Maxwell in the charges.
